definition: Xu Xuan (-991), author of commentaries on Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字註|说文解字注[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4 Zhu4]
slowly/gently
surname Xu
stick-like implement inserted into the handles of a tripod cauldron in ancient times in order to lift the cauldron/commonly used in Korean names, transcribed as "hyun"
Yu Shinan (558-638), politician of Sui and early Tang periods, poet and calligrapher, one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Cai Xiang (1012-1067), Song calligrapher
Li Yu (c. 937-978), given name of the final ruler of Tang of the Five Southern dynasties Li Houzhu 李後主|李后主, a renowned poet
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Wang Yucheng (954-1001) Song dynasty literary figure
Song Qi (998-1061), Song dynasty poet and writer, coauthor of History of the Later Tang Dynasty 新唐書|新唐书
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Tang of the Five Southern Dynasties 937-975
Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
Wang Qinruo (962-1025), Northern Song dynasty official
Chu Suiliang (596-659), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Li Fang (925-996), scholar between Tang and Song dynasties, author of fictional history
Zhao Gou, personal name of the tenth Song Emperor Gaozong 高宗[Gao1 zong1]
